messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: [A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a group of seven scholars: Vicky, Amir, Wim, Raj, Jing, Wei and Nisha. You are friends with Vicky, who can either introduce you to Amir or Wim.  Amir is connected with Raj, and Raj is connected with Wei. Wei is donating 10 books, but you do not take any books, you're just learning about the environment. Then you exit and start over. This time you ask Vicky to introduce you to Wim, who is connected with Jing, and Jing is connected with Nisha. Nisha is donating 50 books, but you do not take any books, you're just learning about the environment. You will only be able to choose one path from Vicky that leads to the maximum number of books. Which scholar can Vicky connect you with, who will lead to the path with maximum number of books?

Nisha is donating 50 books, so it is recommended to be connected to Nisha as much as possible. Therefore, Vicky can introduce you to Wei and the rest will follow suit, resulting in a path with maximum numbers of books.

Now Vicky has a new connection, Reza. Reza is connected to Kim, and Kim is connected to Nisha. When you meet Vicky and choose the path that leads to the maximum number of books, you discover that the regular path to the scholar with the maximum number of books is blocked. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the maximum number of books. Which scholar can Vicky connect you with, will lead to the path where one can make the maximum number of books?

The schema provided has outlived its expected longevity and is no longer usable due to a dependency that no longer exists. It should be discarded and the related operations deprecated. Operations related to this schema may still work for limited periods until the environment detection identifies it as no longer usable.  You can
